Posts.Content: Mar 19, 2013 07:38AM packaging wrote: While I was waiting for my spinal biopsy, the nurse was asking me a bunch of questions. She seemed confused and asked, "They are checking you for spinal metastases? But you had a bilateral mastectomy?!?" I wasn't about to give a nurse a lesson on the science of cancer so I just said "Yep". I was completely annoyed!!
Posts.Title: What's the Dumbest Thing a Medical Professional Has Said to You 4myangels Tweetyb422

Posts.Content: packaging wrote: Hi everyone.  I have bone and liver mets and was having pain in my shoulder blade.  We just started with a plain xray.  We are probably going to do a bone scan next but when the report says "No definite osseous abnormality seen.  Follow up with bone scan or MRI to corrolate with physical symptoms."   Does that mean he may have seen a little something on the xray, or does that mean he say absolutely nothing and he's just saying to follow up based on my history and symptoms? Thanks for your help.  I was just confused because he didn't just say "no abnormalities seen" Maureen Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2014 10:10AM packaging wrote: 37 stage 1 45 stage 4  Not sure what I feel about mammos though.  I felt my lump and it did not show up on mammo.  Ultrasound found it.  Later we found out I had a second cancer not found on mammo.  Dense breasts are definitely a problem.  I hope there is something better for my girls!
